name: deceq2i
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: ax-mp(wceq(cdc(c0, c1), cdc(c0, c2)), wceq(c1, c2))
stmt.pretty: ax-mp(cdc(c0, c1)= cdc(c0, c2), c1 = c2)

body.origin:
|- wceq(cdc(c0, c1), cdc(c0, c2))
-| wceq(c1, c2)
-| wi(wceq(c1, c2), wceq(cdc(c0, c1), cdc(c0, c2)))
body.pretty:
⊢ cdc(c0, c1)= cdc(c0, c2)
⊣ c1 = c2
⊣ (c1 = c2 → cdc(c0, c1)= cdc(c0, c2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cdc(c0, c1), cdc(c0, c2))
-| wceq(c1, c2)
-| wi(wceq(c1, c2), wceq(cdc(c0, c1), cdc(c0, c2)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ cdc(c0, c1)= cdc(c0, c2)
⊣ c1 = c2
⊣ (c1 = c2 → cdc(c0, c1)= cdc(c0, c2))

body.origin: |- wi(wceq(c1, c2), wceq(cdc(c0, c1), cdc(c0, c2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cdc(c0, c1), cdc(c0, c2))
-| wceq(c1, c2)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ cdc(c0, c1)= cdc(c0, c2)
⊣ c1 = c2

comment: Equality theorem for the decimal constructor. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Apr-2015.)
